item.title: "Dgraph, GraphQL, Schemas, and CRUD Summary" from Bill Kennedy
item.description: After learning that Dgraph has native support for GraphQL, Bill Kennedy switched gears and re-wrote his original Dgraph tutorial to show how to use Dgraph with the native GraphQL support.

item.title: Dgraph GraphQL hits GA with v20.03.1
item.description: Dgraph is a distributed, transactional, open source, native graph database. It enables and simplifies the development of scalable cloud applications that continue to thrive even when the data is highly connected and involved.

item.title: The GraphQL Summit story
item.description: We took part in the recently held GraphQL Summit in San Francisco. The conference was exciting, and it had a great line up of talks.

item.title: Building a Native GraphQL Database: Challenges, Learnings and Future
item.description: “GraphQL is not a Graph DB query language — it’s a replacement for REST APIs.” That’s my standard opening statement whenever talking about Dgraph’s choice of the query language.

item.title: Dgraph's recap of GraphQL Conf - Berlin 2019
item.description: We took part in the recently held GraphQL conference in Berlin. The experience was fascinating, and we were amazed by the high voltage enthusiasm in the GraphQL community.
